snippet: The military-appointed leaders said diplomatic efforts to disperse tens of thousands of Islamist backers of the ousted president, Mohamed Morsi, in Cairo had ended.
abstract: Egypt’s military-appointed government says it is giving up negotiating an end to five-week-old standoff with Islamist backers of ousted president Mohamed Morsi, hinting that it might forcibly disperse tens of thousands of them from two sit-ins in capital Cairo.

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim and Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from Cairo, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The military-appointed leaders said diplomatic efforts to disperse tens of thousands of Islamist backers of the ousted president, Mohamed Morsi, in Cairo had ended.

headline.main: Egypt Government Hints at Force to End Large Sit-Ins
headline.print_headline: Egypt Government Hints at Force to End Large Sit-Ins

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
